Value.label: Orientation
Value.Help: The orientation of the ON/OFF on the rocker switch can be inverted by changing the configuration item from 0 to 1

Value.label: Levels
Value.Help: indicates the number of levels the lighting will change when the timer runs out

Value.label: duration
Value.Help: indicates the time duration of each level. The resolution is 10 miliseconds. for example, a default value of 3 means the timer runs out every 30 milliseconds.

Group.label: Group #1 for lifeline communications. Max associations=5. Lifeline association only supports the manual reset event.

Value.label: Night Light
Value.Help: In night-light mode the LED on the switch will turn ON when the switch is turned OFF.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON. Note: If you invert the switches and also install the product upside down, remember the load will now be controlled by the right, not the left switch.

Value.label: Orientation
Value.Help: The orientation of the ON/OFF on the rocker switch can be inverted by changing the configuration item from 0 to 1

Value.label: Levels
Value.Help: indicates the number of levels the lighting will change when the timer runs out

Value.label: duration
Value.Help: indicates the time duration of each level. The resolution is 10 miliseconds. for example, a default value of 3 means the timer runs out every 30 milliseconds.

Group.label: Group #1 for lifeline communications. Max associations=5. Lifeline association only supports the manual reset event.
